description:
I'm used to using VideoReDo on Windows to top-and-tail and remove the commercial breaks from TV recordings. I thought I'd try DVBCut on Ubuntu.

It does the job nearly as well: the cuts in the video and audio streams are perfect, so it rebuilds the MPEG stream correctly. There is a minor difference between DVBCut and VideoRedo: in the former, you should be sitting on the last frame to be included; in VRD, you should be sitting on the first frame not to be included - that caught me out the first time I tried it.

Unfortunately DVBCut does not preserve DVB subtitle streams, though it does preserve multiple audio streams (eg programme audio and audio description for the blind). I'll raise this as an enhancement request.

This build is slightly older than the latest one on Github (0.7.2 rather than 0.7.3) but I can't get the source to compile - it's a shame that the build instructions only mention Debian and not Ubuntu - because of Qt doesn't seem to be installed.
summary: Good, but it doesn't preserve DVB subtitle streams in TS files

description: Schneiden Funktion nicht vorhanden, zu grobe suche

Leider nur MPEG, kein AVC/mp4 oder h.256.
Sehr, sehr schade. Wäre ein tolles Programm wenn es auch aktuellere Kodierungen könnte. MPEG wird heute kaum mehr verwendet.
summary: Nur MPEG, kein mp4 oder h.256
